body_html:
@MalcolmSun : Are you sure you're using 0.12.1 and not a nightly, 1.0.0-alpha or head build (you can confirm with a print tf.__version__)?
tf.pack should exist in 0.12.1 but has been replaced with tf.stack after that.

So, regardless, switching to tf.stack should work (it is available in 0.12.1).
Do let us know if it really is 0.12.1 that is having this trouble.
body_text:
@MalcolmSun : Are you sure you're using 0.12.1 and not a nightly, 1.0.0-alpha or head build (you can confirm with a print tf.__version__)?
tf.pack should exist in 0.12.1 but has been replaced with tf.stack after that.
So, regardless, switching to tf.stack should work (it is available in 0.12.1).
Do let us know if it really is 0.12.1 that is having this trouble.
body:
@MalcolmSun : Are you sure you're using 0.12.1 and not a nightly, 1.0.0-alpha or head build (you can confirm with a `print tf.__version__`)?
`tf.pack` should exist in 0.12.1 but has been replaced with `tf.stack` after that. 

So, regardless, switching to `tf.stack` should work (it is available in 0.12.1).
Do let us know if it really is 0.12.1 that is having this trouble.
